verses.text_plain: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?
verses.verse_html:
1Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing? ▼
▼ rage: or, tumultuously assemble
 , ▼
▼ imagine: Heb. meditate

tokens.definition: גּוֹי gôwy, go'-ee; rarely (shortened) גֹּי gôy; apparently from the same root as H1465 (in the sense of massing); a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts:—Gentile, heathen, nation, people.

tokens.definition: יְהֹוָה Yᵉhôvâh, yeh-ho-vaw'; from H1961 ; (the) self-Existent or Eternal; Jeho-vah, Jewish national name of God:—Jehovah, the Lord. Compare H3050 , H3069 .

tokens.definition: גִּיל gîyl, gheel; or (by permutation) גּוּל gûwl; a primitive root; properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear:—be glad, joy, be joyful, rejoice.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: rejoice (27x), glad (10x), joyful (4x), joy (2x), delight (1x).
outline: to rejoice, exult, be glad (Qal) to rejoice to tremble (from fear)

tokens.definition: רַעַד raʻad, rah'-ad; or (feminine) רְעָדָה rᵉʻâdâhxlit rᵉâdâh corrected to rᵉʻâdâh; from H7460 ; a shudder:—trembling.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: trembling (4x), fear (1x), fearfulness (1x).

verses.text_plain: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.
verses.verse_html: 12Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.

tokens.definition: נָשַׁק nâshaq, naw-shak'; a primitive root (identical with H5400 , through the idea of fastening up; compare H2388 , H2836 ); to kiss, literally or figuratively (touch); also (as a mode of attachment), to equip with weapons:—armed (men), rule, kiss, that touched.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: kiss (29x), armed (2x), kissed him (1x), armed men (1x), ruled (1x), touched (1x).

tokens.definition: אָנַף ʼânaph, aw-naf'; a primitive root; to breathe hard, i.e. be enraged:—be angry (displeased).
